doc.ContractDescription: PROTECTING FOREST CARBON STORAGE AND UPTAKE IS CENTRAL TO NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL POLICES AIMED AT MITIGATING CLIMATE CHANGE. THE SUCCESS OF SUCH POLICIES RELIES ON HIGH QUALITY, ACCURATE REPORTING (TIER 3) THAT EARNS THE GREATEST FINANCIAL VALUE OF CARBON CREDITS AND HENCE INCENTIVIZES FOREST CONSERVATION AND PROTECTION. METHODS FOR TIER 3 MEASURING, REPORTING, AND VERIFICATION (MRV) TO ASSESS CARBON STOCKS AND FLUXES OVER TIME AND FOR LARGE AREAS (NATIONAL TO SUB-NATIONAL) ARE STILL IN DEVELOPMENT. THEY GENERALLY INVOLVE SOME COMBINATION OF DIRECT REMOTE SENSING, GROUND BASED INVENTORYING, AND COMPUTER MODELING, BUT HAVE TENDED TO EMPHASIZE ASSESSMENTS OF LIVE ABOVEGROUND CARBON STOCKS WITH A LESS CLEAR CONNECTION TO THE REAL TARGET OF MRV WHICH IS CARBON EMISSIONS AND REMOVALS. MOST EXISTING METHODS ARE ALSO LARGELY AMBIGUOUS AS TO THE MECHANISMS THAT UNDERLIE CARBON ACCUMULATION, AND MANY HAVE LIMITED CAPACITY FOR FORECASTING CARBON DYNAMICS OVER TIME. THIS PROJECTS CORE OBJECTIVE IS TO BUILD NEW CAPACITY FOR A MORE THOROUGH APPROACH BY ADVANCING OUR EXISTING CARBON STOCK AND FLUX MONITORING FRAMEWORK (WILLIAMS ET AL. 2012, 2013) TO DELIVER A NEW TOOL FOR TIER 3 MRV, DECISION SUPPORT, AND FORECASTING, ALL WITH PROCESS-SPECIFICITY. THE PROPOSED METHODOLOGY BEGINS WITH EXTENDING OUR EXISTING FRAMEWORK BY PROVIDING A MORE DETAILED FAMILY OF CARBON FLUX AND STOCK TRAJECTORIES, AND MAPPING THEM TO A 1X1 KM SCALE FOR THE CONTERMINOUS US BASED ON NEW AND EMERGING DATA PRODUCTS. A NUMBER OF IMPROVEMENTS TO THE FRAMEWORK ARE PROPOSED (TASKS 1 TO 5), DESIGNED TO FURTHER CHARACTERIZE THE ATTRIBUTES OF FORESTED PIXELS BEYOND THE REGIONALLY-DEFINED STRATA USED IN OUR PRIOR WORK (FOREST TYPE, SITE PRODUCTIVITY, AND AGE) TO NOW ALSO INCLUDE PRE-DISTURBANCE BIOMASS, DISTURBANCE TYPE, AND DISTURBANCE SEVERITY ATTRIBUTES BASED ON RECENTLY DEVELOPED RS-DERIVED BIOMASS MAPS (E.G. KELLNDORFER ET AL. 2012, SAATCHI ET AL. 2013), AND LANDSAT-DERIVED DISTURBANCE PRODUCTS LINKED TO THE NAFD PROJECT. FLUX AND STOCK TRAJECTORIES WILL ALSO BE ADJUSTED TO ACCOUNT FOR ANY GROWTH ENHANCEMENTS WE MAY DETECT FROM DETAILED ANALYSIS FIA DATA (TASK 6). ACCOUNTING OF THE FATE OF HARVESTED WOOD PRODUCTS WILL BE ADDED (TASK 7) TO PREPARE THE FRAMEWORK FOR MORE COMPLETE ASSESSMENT OF THE FOREST SECTOR CARBON BALANCE. WE WILL THEN MAP CARBON FLUXES AND STOCKS BY ASSIGNING VALUES FROM MODELED TRAJECTORIES TO FOREST ATTRIBUTES DEFINED AT A PIXEL SCALE (TASK 8). THE IMPROVED FRAMEWORK WILL BE APPLIED FOR TIER 3 MRV, YIELDING REGIONAL AND COUNTRY-SCALE ANNUAL CARBON FLUXES AND STOCKS FROM 1990 TO 2011 (TASK 9). IT WILL ALSO BE APPLIED IN A FORECASTING MODE TO TEST CARBON IMPLICATIONS OF LIKELY MANAGEMENT AND NATURAL DISTURBANCE SCENARIOS (TASK 10).

doc.ContractDescription: PSO SERVICES, VERMONT, 6/1/16 - 9/30/16 IGF::CL,CT::IGF
FUNDS OBLIGATION TAS::69 8106::TAS

GOAL OUR OVERALL GOAL IS THREE-FOLD: 1) TO USE SOIL MOISTURE ACTIVE PASSIVE (SMAP) PRODUCT AS FORCING FOR SOIL NITROUS OXIDE (N2O) AND METHANE (CH4) EMISSION MODULES INTEGRATED IN THE COMMUNITY LAND MODEL WITH PROGNOSTIC CARBON AND NITROGEN (CLM-CN) TO IMPROVE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF PROCESSES, MECHANISMS, AND CONTROLS UNDERLYING THESE EMISSIONS; 2) TO USE SMAP PASSIVE PRODUCT FOR EVALUATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF CLM-SIMULATED SOIL MOISTURE, WHICH WILL SIMULTANEOUSLY CORRECT OTHER RELEVANT STATE VARIABLES AND STRENGTHEN THE PREDICTION ABILITY OF TRACE GAS EMISSIONS; 3) TO PERFORM SENSITIVITY EXPERIMENTS THAT SPAN PLAUSIBLE CLIMATE-CHANGES WITH THE IMPROVED MODEL SYSTEM AND THEREBY ASSESS POTENTIAL CHANGES IN NATURAL EMISSION RATES OF KEY TRACE GASES (PARTICULARLY CO2, CH4, AND N2O) AS WELL AS THEIR RELATIVE CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE CLIMATE FEEDBACK. PROJECT SUMMARY RECENT STUDIES HAVE SUGGESTED THAT THE COMBINED EFFECT ON CLIMATE OF INCREASES IN THE CONCENTRATIONS OF SEVERAL TRACE GASES (PRINCIPALLY CH4 AND N2O) COULD RIVAL OR EVEN EXCEED THAT OF THE INCREASING CONCENTRATION OF CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2), DUE TO THEIR MUCH STRONGER ABILITIES IN ABSORBING INFRARED RADIATION. DESPITE THEIR POTENT POTENTIAL FOR CLIMATE FEEDBACK, THE SPECIFIC SOURCES, MAGNITUDES, AND CHANGES OF THESE TRACE-GAS EMISSIONS ARE STILL NOT WELL UNDERSTOOD. THERE EXIST LARGE UNCERTAINTIES IN CURRENT AND FUTURE ESTIMATES OF THESE EMISSIONS AS A RESULT OF POORLY UNDERSTOOD MECHANISMS, UNCERTAINTIES IN MODEL PARAMETERIZATIONS AND INSUFFICIENTLY PERFORMED MODEL EVALUATIONS (ALL BECAUSE OF A LACK OF DATA). NEVERTHELESS, IT IS WELL ESTABLISHED THAT THE STATE AND AMOUNT OF WATER IN THE SOIL IS A KEY PLAYER IN MODULATING THESE TRACE GAS EMISSIONS. THEREFORE, WE PROPOSE TO USE THE UNPRECEDENTED GLOBAL HIGH-RESOLUTION LAND SURFACE SOIL MOISTURE AND FREEZE/THAW STATE FROM SMAP TOGETHER WITH OTHER LAND-BASED OBSERVATIONS TO CONSTRAIN OUR RECENTLY DEVELOPED SOIL N2O AND CH4 EMISSION MODULES INTEGRATED IN THE CLM-CN VERSION 3.5. FIRST, SMAP SOIL MOISTURE WILL BE USED AS FORCING FOR OUR EMISSION MODULES TO PROVIDE LAND DATA CONSISTENT WITH OBSERVATIONS. BY COMPARING THE EMISSIONS OBTAINED FROM THE MODELS AND THE GROUND-BASED MEASUREMENTS, THE DETAIL PROCESS-LEVEL MECHANISMS AND CONTROLS UNDERLYING THESE EMISSIONS CAN BE BETTER UNDERSTOOD. NEXT, SMAP PASSIVE PRODUCT WILL BE USED TO EVALUATE THE PARAMETERIZATIONS IN CLM. BY COMPARING CLM-SIMULATED SOIL MOISTURE WITH DAILY HIGH-RESOLUTION (36-KM) SMAP PASSIVE PRODUCT, WE HOPE TO DIAGNOSE THE DETAILS OF MODEL SYSTEMATIC ERRORS ASSOCIATED WITH SOIL MOISTURE SIMULATION AND REDUCE THESE ERRORS WITH IMPROVED PARAMETERIZATIONS. THIS MAY SIMULTANEOUSLY IMPROVE THE SIMULATIONS OF OTHER RELEVANT MOISTURE STORES (I.E. SUBSURFACE MOISTURE ETC.). THE ENHANCED CLM PERFORMANCE WILL BE EXPECTED TO SUBSEQUENTLY REDUCE THE UNCERTAINTIES IN THE PROJECTIONS OF FUTURE TRACE GAS EMISSIONS. A SET OF SENSITIVITY EXPERIMENTS WILL BE ALSO PERFORMED WITH THE MIT INTEGRATED GLOBAL SYSTEMS MODEL (IGSM) FRAMEWORK TO INVESTIGATE THE FATE OF KEY TRACE-GAS EMISSIONS (PRIMARILY CO2, CH4, AND N2O) AND THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF INDIVIDUAL OR COMBINED EMISSION(S) TO CLIMATE FEEDBACKS UNDER VARIOUS POLICY/NO-POLICY EMISSION SCENARIOS. ANTICIPATED OUTCOME: FROM THIS RESEARCH, WE EXPECT TO IMPROVE THE PERFORMANCE OF CLM S SOIL MOISTURE SIMULATIONS, ENHANCE THE N2O AND CH4 MODULES AND THEREBY REDUCE UNCERTAINTIES IN THE EMISSION ESTIMATES OVER A MAJORITY OF THE EARTH S LAND SURFACES. THESE ANTICIPATED IMPROVEMENTS WILL ULTIMATELY SUPPORT GREATER CONFIDENCE IN ASSESSING THE FATE OF VARIOUS KEY TRACE-GAS EMISSIONS AND THE RELATIVE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THESE NATURAL EMISSION CHANGES (SEPARATE AND COMBINED) TO THE CLIMATE FEEDBACKS UNDER VARIOUS CLIMATE-CHANGE SCENARIOS.

BLANKET PURCHASE AGREEMENT (BPA) CALL ORDER TITLE: FY 16/17 TECHNICAL, ANALYTIC AND OUTREACH SERVICES FOR THE EPA'S COALBED METHANE OUTREACH PROGRAM THE PURPOSE OF THIS BPA CALL ORDER IS TO PROVIDE OVERALL TECHNICAL AND OUTREACH SUPPORT SERVICES FOR THE COALBED METHANE OUTREACH PROGRAM (CMOP). PROGRAM SERVICES MAY INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, OVERALL CMOP PROGRAM SERVICES, AS WELL AS, REGULATORY, AND TECHNICAL ANALYSIS TO SUPPORT CAPACITY BUILDING TO ACHIEVE COAL MINE METHANE (CMM) EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS. SPECIFIC ELEMENTS UNDER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE PROGRAM MANAGEMENT, WEBSITE AND ELECTRONIC MAILING SERVICES, TECHNICAL AND ANALYTICAL SUPPORT, OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATIONS SUPPORT, AND PUBLICATIONS AND MATERIALS/TOOLS SUPPORT. THE FOLLOWING TASKS ARE TO BE PERFORMED: TASK 1: PROJECT MANAGEMENT TASK 2: CMOP WEBSITE (HOSTING, MAINTENANCE AND ENHANCEMENT) AND ELECTRONIC MAILING SERVICES TASK 3: TECHNICAL AND ANALYTIC SUPPORT FOR U.S. CMM PROJECTS IGF::OT::IGF

doc.ContractDescription: AIR BEAM SHELTER SYSTEM

ROBUST ESTIMATES OF THE DISTRIBUTION OF CARBON CONTAINED IN THE ABOVEGROUND BIOMASS (AGB) OF FORESTS ARE NEEDED FOR THE GLOBE TO REDUCE THE UNCERTAINTIES ASSOCIATED WITH GLOBAL CARBON BUDGETS AND TO IMPROVE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF HOW CARBON CYCLE POOLS AND PROCESSES VARY ACROSS SPACE AND TIME. IN SUPPORT OF NASA STUDIES WITH ICESAT AND CRYOSAT-2, AND ACKNOWLEDGING THE KEY INSIGHTS THAT GLAS LIDAR OBSERVATIONS HAVE ALREADY PROVIDED WHERE THE ESTIMATION OF AGB IS CONCERNED, THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS TO PRODUCE THE FIRST GLOBALLY CONSISTENT, WALL-TO-WALL MAP OF AGB AT AN UNPRECEDENTED RESOLUTION OF ~500 M. IN DOING SO, WE WILL DEMONSTRATE THE GREAT POTENTIAL OF SPACEBORNE LIDAR TO FILL A CRITICAL DATA GAP WHILE SOLVING A SCALING CHALLENGE THAT HAS LONG PLAGUED LARGE-AREA MAPPING STUDIES: HOW TO OPTIMALLY LINK SPARSE FIELD MEASUREMENTS WITH WALL-TO-WALL SATELLITE IMAGERY TO PRODUCE CONSISTENT AND ACCURATE ESTIMATES OF AGB AT THE GLOBAL SCALE. THE PROPOSAL TEAM HAS SPENT THE LAST DECADE ADVANCING METHODS FOR LARGE-AREA AGB MAPPING USING STRATEGIES THAT COMBINE FIELD MEASUREMENTS, SPACEBORNE LIDAR, AND OPTICAL IMAGERY. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH BUILDS DIRECTLY UPON THESE EFFORTS, SPECIFICALLY LEVERAGING RESULTS FROM A RECENT PEER-REVIEWED EFFORT TO PRODUCE THE FIRST SPATIALLY EXPLICIT MAP OF AGB FOR THE PAN-TROPICAL BELT AT A RESOLUTION OF ~500 M (BACCINI ET AL., 2012). THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES/DELIVERABLES ARE TO: (1) GENERATE A GLOBAL DATABASE OF GLAS FOOTPRINT-LEVEL ESTIMATES OF ABOVEGROUND BIOMASS. WE WILL DEVELOP STATISTICAL MODELS LINKING FIELD-BASED ESTIMATES OF AGB WITH GLAS WAVEFORM METRICS ASSOCIATED WITH A SUBSET OF CO-LOCATED GLAS FOOTPRINTS TO PROVIDE ACCURATE ESTIMATES OF AGB AT THE FOOTPRINT SCALE FOR THE CA. 2007/08 TIMEFRAME. (2) PRODUCE A GLOBALLY CONSISTENT MOSAIC OF MODIS NBAR IMAGERY AT A RESOLUTION OF ~500 M. LEVERAGING A TIME-SERIES OF MODIS NBAR IMAGERY FROM THE CA. 2007/08 TIMEFRAME, WE WILL PRODUCE A BEST-QUALITY, GLOBAL MOSAIC OF CLOUD-/SNOW-FREE, STANDARDIZED SPECTRAL REFLECTANCE DATA. (3) GENERATE A GLOBAL MAP OF ABOVEGROUND BIOMASS AT A RESOLUTION OF ~500 M. USING THE PRODUCTS FROM OBJECTIVES (1) AND (2), WE WILL USE TREE-BASED REGRESSION TO MODEL THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN GLAS FOOTPRINT-LEVEL ESTIMATES OF AGB AND MODIS SPECTRAL REFLECTANCE TOGETHER WITH ANCILLARY DATA (E.G., ALOS/PALSAR HH INTENSITY, SRTM ELEVATION, ETC.). THE RESULTING MODEL(S) WILL BE USED TO MAP AGB WALL-TO-WALL FOR THE GLOBE. (4) PROVIDE UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATES AT THE FOOTPRINT- (GLAS) AND PIXEL-LEVEL (MODIS) FOR THE BIOMASS PRODUCTS GENERATED AS PART OF OBJECTIVES (1) AND (3). WE WILL CONDUCT AN ERROR PROPAGATION ANALYSIS TO QUANTIFY ERRORS ASSOCIATED WITH EACH INDIVIDUAL INPUT AND STEP IN THE MODELING PROCESS BEGINNING WITH THE FIELD MEASUREMENTS OF STEM DIAMETER AND ENDING WITH THE GLOBAL MAP OF AGB. THE ANALYSIS WILL PROVIDE ESTIMATES OF UNCERTAINTY FOR EACH GLAS FOOTPRINT AS WELL AS FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL PIXEL IN THE GLOBAL MAP. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS HIGHLY RELEVANT TO THE NRA BY RESPONDING DIRECTLY TO THE STATED GOAL OF IMPROVING OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE EARTH SYSTEM THROUGH THE PROVISION OF INFORMATION ON VEGETATION STRUCTURE AND ESTIMATION OF GLOBAL BIOMASS. BEYOND THE GOALS OF THE NRA, THE RESEARCH IS RELEVANT TO NASA S TERRESTRIAL ECOLOGY/CARBON CYCLE SCIENCE PROGRAMS BY IMPROVING OUR UNDERSTANDING OF CRITICAL COMPONENTS OF THE GLOBAL CARBON CYCLE, ADVANCING THE INTEGRATION OF MULTI-SENSOR APPROACHES TO ESTIMATING KEY CARBON CYCLE VARIABLES, AND ADDRESSING THE GOAL OF QUANTIFYING BIOMASS IN TERRESTRIAL ECOSYSTEMS. THE RESEARCH IS ALSO HIGHLY RELEVANT TO THE NASA CARBON MONITORING SYSTEM INITIATIVE, WHICH IS FOCUSED ON QUANTIFYING TERRESTRIAL VEGETATION CARBON STOCKS, FIRST FOR THE U.S. AND THEN GLOBALLY. FINALLY, OUR WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TO EFFORTS FOCUSED ON ANSWERING KEY QUESTIONS RELEVANT TO THE EFFICACY OF NASA'S ICESAT-2 MISSION FOR ECOSYSTEM STRUCTURE CHARACTERIZATION.

doc.ContractDescription: ADVANCED MICRO PULSED PLASMA THRUSTER

OVERVIEW: BLACK HOLES ARE UBIQUITOUS IN THE UNIVERSE AND PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN ITS EVOLUTION. ATTEMPTS TO MODEL ACCRETION FLOWS AND JETS AROUND BLACK HOLES HAVE BEEN SEVERELY HAMPERED BY THE REQUIREMENT THAT ALL THEIR PROPERTIES MUST BE INFERRED SOLELY BY MODELING THE RADIATION THAT EMERGES FROM THEM. THE PROPOSED RESEARCH PROJECT WILL GENERATE THE FIRST LARGE DYNAMIC RANGE,PREDICTIVE NUMERICAL MODELS OF BLACK-HOLE ACCRETION FLOWS AND JETS THAT WILL BE DIRECTLY COMPARABLE TO CURRENT AND FUTURE, EARTH- AND SPACE-BASED OBSERVATIONS. ITS MAIN AIM IS TO DEVELOP, VALIDATE, AND INCORPORATE INTO NUMERICAL SIMULATIONS EMPIRICAL MODELS FOR PHYSICAL PROCESSES THAT OCCUR AT LENGTH SCALES THAT ARE UNRESOLVABLE WITH CURRENT COMPUTER CAPABILITIES. INTELLECTUAL MERITS: THE PROPOSED RESEARCH ADDRESSES A FUNDAMENTAL OUTSTANDING PROBLEM IN BLACK-HOLE ASTROPHYSICS BY BRINGING TOGETHER THE EXPERTISE OF RESEARCHERS IN THREE NODES, THE UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND, HARVARD UNIVERSITY, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF ARIZONA. IT RELIES ON CROSS FERTILIZATION WITH OTHER DISCIPLINES OF PLASMA PHYSICS AND ASTRONOMY RELATED TO THE MODELING OF HYDRODYNAMIC AND MAGNETOHYDRODYNAMIC TURBULENCE. IT WILL HAVE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON MANY OTHER ASTROPHYSICAL COMMUNITIES SUPPORTED BY NSF AND NASA. IT WILL GENERATE PREDICTIONS FOR THE HIGH-ENERGY PROPERTIES OF BLACK HOLES AS OBSERVED BY THE CHANDRA AND FERMI OBSERVATORIES. IT WILL PROVIDE TOOLS THAT WILL BE USED IN INFERRING THE EVOLUTION OF BLACK-HOLE MASSES AND SPINS WITH COSMIC TIME BASED ON OBSERVATIONS WITH LSST, JWST, AND SLOAN. IT WILL ALSO GENERATE MICROPHYSICAL MODELS THAT WILL BE READILY AVAILABLE FOR SIMULATIONS OF THE ELECTROMAGNETIC COUNTERPARTS OF GRAVITATIONAL WAVE SOURCES. A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THEORIES OF DISKS, JETS, AND STRONG-FIELD GRAVITY WILL HAVE A BROAD IMPACT ON ALL OF BH ASTROPHYSICS. THE COSMOLOGICAL EVOLUTION OF BH MASS AND SPIN AND LARGE-SCALE STRUCTURE FORMATION ARE AFFECTED BY RADIATIVE AND JET FEEDBACK, WHICH CONTROL HOW FAST BHS CAN GROW (JET PUSHING BACK ON GAS) AND BY BH SPIN (HIGHER SPIN LEADS TO LARGER FEEDBACK). BH SPIN MEASUREMENTS USING THE IRON LINE OR CONTINUUM METHOD OFTEN ASSUME THE BH, DISK, AND JET ARE ALIGNED, WHILE GENERALLY SIMULATIONS GIVE NON-TRIVIAL RESULTS. TIDAL DISRUPTION EVENTS ARE DETERMINED BY HOW MAGNETIC FIELDS AMPLIFY IN DISKS AND JETS. BH-BH MERGER KICKS ARE LIMITED BY HOW THE SPIN DIRECTION CHANGES DUE TO ACCRETION OF PRE-EXISTING GAS. ELECTROMAGNETIC COUNTERPARTS TO GRAVITATIONAL WAVES FROM COMPACT MERGERS ARE DETERMINED BY HOW LONG MAGNETIZED ACCRETION LASTS, HOW JETS FORM, WHAT DIRECTION JETS POINT. BROADER IMPACTS: THE COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH WILL RESULT IN THE EDUCATION OF THREE POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCHERS IN STATE-OF-THE-ART COMPUTATIONAL METHODS AND BLACK-HOLE ASTROPHYSICS. MOREOVER, THE PIS OF THE PROJECT IN THE THREE NODES WILL CONTINUE THEIR COMMITMENT TO THE DISSEMINATION OF THE KNOWLEDGE ACQUIRED DURING HE PROJECT TO THE WIDER RESEARCH COMMUNITY, THROUGH THE ORGANIZATION OF INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCES, AND TO THE PUBLIC, THROUGH PUBLIC TALKS AND MEDIA PRESENTATIONS. ALL CODE AND DOCUMENTATION WILL BE MADE OPEN SOURCE. WE WILL HIRE SUMMER UNDERGRADUATES, TRAIN GRADUATE STUDENTS, AND SPONSOR POSTDOCTORAL RESEARCHERS AS PART OF THIS RESEARCH PLAN.

doc.ContractDescription: OBSERVATIONS OF YOUNG STELLAR OBJECTS INDICATE THAT WITHIN JUST SEVERAL MILLION YEARS (MY), NEARLY ALL OF THE MASS OF THE DISK IS ACCRETED TO FORM THE CENTRAL STAR WHILE NEARLY ALL OF THE ANGULAR MOMENTUM IS TRANSPORTED OUTWARD. THE MECHANISM DRIVING THIS MASS AND MOMENTUM TRANSFER REMAINS A KEY UNSOLVED PROBLEM. A SECOND FUNDAMENTAL QUESTION CONCERNS THE FORMATION OF MILLIMETER-SIZED PARTICLES KNOWN AS CHONDRULES, THOUGHT TO BE THE PRIMARY BUILDING BLOCKS OF THE INNER PLANETS AND ASTEROIDS. THE PROCESSES RESPONSIBLE FOR CHONDRULE FORMATION ARE ENIGMATIC. KNOWLEDGE OF THE INTENSITY OF NEBULAR FIELDS COULD ENABLE DISCRIMINATION BETWEEN THE VARIOUS MECHANISMS PROPOSED FOR DISK EVOLUTION AND CHONDRULE FORMATION. BECAUSE ASTRONOMICAL OBSERVATIONS CANNOT MEASURE MAGNETIC FIELDS IN THE DISK MIDPLANE, PALEOMAGNETIC EXPERIMENTS ARE CURRENTLY THE ONLY WAY TO PROBE THESE FIELDS. WITH THIS GOAL, WE PROPOSE TWO TASKS: TASK 1: EXPERIMENTALLY DETERMINE MAGNETIC FIELD STRENGTHS IN THE SOLAR NEBULA AS RECORDED BY CHONDRULES IN THE LL, CR, AND CM CHONDRITE GROUPS. TASK 2: MODEL THE EVOLUTION OF MAGNETIC FIELDS DURING CHONDRULE FORMATION BY LARGE-SCALE SHOCKS AND BOW SHOCKS.

doc.ContractDescription: MATLAB MAINTENANCE/SOFTWARE

RESEARCH THAT SUPPORTS QUANTITATIVE ASSESSMENT OF MARS' SURFACE AS A POTENTIAL HABITAT FOR LIFE, PAST OR PRESENT, IS OF CRITICAL IMPORTANCE TO THE FUTURE OF NASA'S MARS EXPLORATION PROGRAM. IN THIS PROPOSAL, WE PRESENT A RESEARCH PROGRAM TO SUPPORT IMPROVEMENTS IN OUR UNDERSTANDING OF CHEMICAL COMPOSITION OF MARTIAN MATERIALS AS MEASURED IN SITU USING THE TECHNIQUE OF LASERINDUCED BREAKDOWN SPECTROSCOPY (LIBS). THROUGH KNOWLEDGE OF COMPOSITION AND MINERALOGY INFERRED FROM ITS RESULTS, WE CAN BETTER CHARACTERIZE GEOLOGICAL FEATURES ON MARS, INCLUDING THOSE THAT SUPPORT INTERPRETATIONS RELATED TO THE ROLE OF AQUEOUS PROCESSES. IN SERVICE OF THESE MARS PROGRAM GOALS, THIS PROPOSAL SEEKS TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS IN THE ACCURACY OF CHEMICAL ANALYSES DERIVED FROM LIBS DATA, SUCH AS THOSE FROM THE CHEMCAM INSTRUMENT ON THE CURIOSITY ROVER. TO THIS END, WE WILL USE TRANSFER LEARNING TECHNIQUES TO ADDRESS THREE FUNDAMENTAL OBJECTIVES: 1. UNDERSTAND THE EFFECTS OF VARIABLE ABLATION AND COLLECTION ANGLES ON THE ACCURACY OF CHEMICAL ANALYSES DERIVED FROM LIBS. 2. DEVELOP CORRECTIONS FOR VARIATIONS IN SPECTRAL RESOLUTION, PULSE ENERGY, INSTRUMENT DRIFT, SIGNAL TO NOISE, AND SAMPLE PREPARATION ACROSS DIFFERENCE LIBS INSTRUMENTS TO FACILITATE INTER-LABORATORY COMPARISONS AND CROSS-CALIBRATIONS. 3. IMPLEMENT A COMPUTATIONAL METHOD TO CORRECT FOR VARIABLE DISTANCE BETWEEN TARGET AND LASER BASED ON IN SITU ANALYSES OF DUST ON MARS. THIS FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH IS DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO THE MARS FUNDAMENTAL RESEARCH PROGRAM BECAUSE IT PROVIDES NOVEL, ENHANCED ALGORITHMS TO SUPPORT AND IMPROVE QUANTITATIVE CHEMICAL ANALYSES OF MARTIAN MATERIALS. IT IS SIGNIFICANT BECAUSE IT WILL IMPROVE THE BREADTH AND ACCURACY OF CHEMICAL ANALYSES FROM CHEMCAM AND FUTURE LIBS INSTRUMENTS, ENHANCING OUR UNDERSTANDING OF GEOCHEMICAL AND GEOLOGICAL PROCESSES ON THE SURFACE OF MARS.
doc.MajorAgency: TRANSFER LEARNING FOR CHEMICAL ANALYSES FROM LASER
doc.MajorFundingAgency: TRANSFER LEARNING FOR CHEMICAL ANALYSES FROM LASER

THIS ORDER COVERS THE FOLLOWING: PARTNERSHIP MANAGEMENT, PARTNER ASSISTANCE, PROJECT ASSISTANCE, OUTREACH, POLICY SUPPORT, AND WEB SUPPORT. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING TASKS: TASK 1: PARTNERSHIP INFORMATION/ DATABASE MANAGEMENT; TASK 2: PARTNER IMPLEMENTATION AND SUPPORT; AD HOC REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE; TASK 3: OUTREACH COLLATERAL DEVELOPMENT AND SUPPORT; TASK 4: MAINTAIN AND UPDATE CHP PARTNERSHIP (CHPP) POLICY AND INCENTIVES DATABASE; TASK 5: MEETINGS SUPPORT; TASK 6: PUBLIC RECOGNITION FOR CHP PROJECTS; TASK 7: WEB SUPPORT; AND TASK 8: CHPP WEBINAR SERIES THE PURPOSE OF MODIFICATION NO. 2 IS TO ADD INCREMENTAL FUNDING. doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF AS PART OF A NASA GAME CHANGING TECHNOLOGIES PROGRAM, BUSEK DEVELOPED A FULLY INTEGRATED PROTOTYPE 100UN-CLASS SYSTEM (BET-100UN) SUITABLE FOR INTEGRATION INTO CUBESAT PLATFORMS. THIS STATEMENT OF WORK OUTLINES THE EFFORT TO FLIGHT-QUALIFY THE ELECTROSPRAY SYSTEM DEVELOPED AS PART OF THE MICROFLUIDIC ELECTROSPRAY PROPULSION (MEP) PHASE I PROGRAM. THE FINAL INTEGRATED UNITS DELIVERED AS PART OF THE PHASE I WERE INTENDED TO BE VIABLE FOR LOW EARTH ORBIT (LEO) DEMONSTRATION AFTER COMPLETION OF A QUALIFICATION EFFORT. THE WORK DESCRIBED HEREIN IS INTENDED TO: PERFORM ADDITIONAL ANALYSIS AND TESTING TO FURTHER CHARACTERIZE THE PHASE I DELIVERABLE DESIGN, CONDUCT A QUALIFICATION PROGRAM, FABRICATE FLIGHT HARDWARE, SUPPORT PROPULSION SYSTEM INTEGRATION INTO THE SPACECRAFT, AND SUPPORT FLIGHT OPERATIONS. THE FLIGHT UNITS ARE INTENDED FOR INTEGRATION INTO A 6U CUBESAT AND LEO DEMONSTRATION AS PART OF THE NASA PATHFINDER TECHNOLOGY DEMONSTRATOR PROJECT, SPONSORED BY THE SMALL SPACECRAFT TECHNOLOGY PROGRAM (SSTP). THE INTEGRATED ELECTROSPRAY THRUSTER SYSTEM CONSISTS OF A TWO-BOARD ELECTRICAL STACK, WITH EXTERNAL DIMENSIONS OF 9.5CM X 9.5CM X 3.3CM, EQUIVALENT TO 1/3U IN A CUBESAT FROM FACTOR. THE FIRST 9.5CM X 9.5CM BOARD HOUSES THE ENTIRETY OF THE ELECTRONICS; A POWER PROCESSING UNIT (PPU), AND THE DIGITAL CONTROL INTERFACE UNIT (DCIU) LOCATED ON A SMALL MEZZANINE BOARD. THE SECOND 9.5CM X 9.5CM BOARD HOUSES THE 100μN ELECTROSPRAY THRUSTER, AS WELL AS A CARBON NANOTUBE FIELD EMISSION CATHODE (CNTFEC) USED TO NEUTRALIZE THE EMITTED ELECTROSPRAY BEAM.

doc.ContractDescription: THIS PROPOSAL TO THE NASA AMES RESEARCH CENTER (ARC) IS IN RESPONSE TO AN EMAIL REQUEST FROM CHARLES SOBECK, REQUESTING THAT THE SMITHSONIAN ASTROPHYSICAL OBSERVATORY (SAO) SUBMIT A PROPOSAL TO CARRY OUT FOLLOW-UP OBSERVATIONS DURING THE KEPLER OBJECTS OF INTEREST (KOIS) USING THE TILLINGHAST REFLECTOR ECHELLE SPECTROGRAPH (TRES) ON THE 1.5-M TELESCOPE AT THE FRED LAWRENCE WHIPPLE OBSERVATORY ON MOUNT HOPKINS, ARIZONA, AND THE HARPS-N INSTRUMENTS ON THE 3.6-M TELESCOPIO NAZIONALE GALILEO (TNG) AT OBSERVATORIO DEL ROQUE DE LOS MUCHASCHOS ON LA PALMA, SPAIN, AND TO DERIVE STELLAE PARAMETERS FROM THESE SPECTRA USING THE STELLAR PARAMENTER CLASSIFICATION (SPC) TOOL. SAO WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO APPLY SPC TO HIGH-RESOLUTION SPECTRA OF KOIS PROVIDED BY OTHERS. ANOTHER MAJOR EFFORT WILL BE THE APPLICATION OF BLENDER TO AN ANALYSIS OF KOIS, WITH THE GOAL OF VALIDATING PLANETS BY PROVIDING A QUANTITATIVE ESTIMATE OF THE PROBABLILITY THAT THE OBSERVED TRANSITS ARE DUE TO PLANETS AND NOT TO CONTAMINATION BY AN ECLISING BINARY. FINALLY, SAO SCIENTISTS WILL CONTINUE TO PARTIPATE IN THE PREPARATION OF PAPERS FOR PRESENTATION AND PUBLICATION.

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF DEVELOPING RETRIEVAL ALGORITHMS FOR NH3 AND CO FROM NPP CRIS MEASUREMENTS. AMMONIA (NH3) AND CARBON MONOXIDE (CO) PLAY KEY ROLES IN ATMOSPHERIC CHEMISTRY: NH3 AS PART OF THE NITROGEN CYCLE AND CO AS A PRECURSOR FOR OZONE AND CARBON DIOXIDE. CONTINUING INDUSTRIALIZATION ACROSS THE GLOBE IS ALTERING THE SOURCE INTENSITY AND DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GASES BOTH DIRECTLY AND THROUGH TEMPERATURE AND MOISTURE ADJUSTMENTS DUE TO CLIMATE CHANGE. IN TURN THESE SPECIES ALSO AFFECT THE CLIMATE: NH3 IS AN IMPORTANT SOURCE OF PM2.5 AEROSOLS THAT HAVE A SMALL BUT HIGHLY UNCERTAIN RADIATIVE EFFECT. CO IS ESTIMATED TO HAVE AN INDIRECT FORCING OF 0.2 W/M2. FEEDBACKS ASSOCIATED WITH CLIMATE CHANGE WILL MODULATE THE EFFECT NH3 AND CO HAVE ON ATMOSPHERIC CHEMISTRY, AIR QUALITY AND THE CLIMATE ITSELF. BOTH SPECIES ARE HIGHLY VARIABLE IN SPACE AND TIME NH3 MORE SO THAN CO AND IT IS DIFFICULT TO PREDICT FUTURE EMISSIONS BASED ON THE CURRENT DATABASES, WHICH ARE SPARSE OVER MUCH OF THE EARTH. NASA EOS INSTRUMENTS LIKE TES, MOPITT, AND AIRS HAVE PROVIDED A WEALTH OF INFORMATION ON THE DISTRIBUTION OF THESE GASES, AND SHOWN THAT CO LEVELS ARE IS DECREASING SIGNIFICANTLY. HOWEVER, THEY ARE WELL PAST THEIR DESIGN LIFE AND SO THE FUTURE OF THESE CRITICAL NASA EOS RECORDS IS ENDANGERED. THE CRIS INSTRUMENTS ON THE SUOMI NPP SATELLITE AND ON THE FUTURE JPSS PLATFORMS HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO MONITOR THESE SPECIES ACROSS THE GLOBE OVER MANY YEARS ACCURATELY AND CONSISTENTLY. OUR PROPOSED PROJECT WILL DEVELOP THE ALGORITHMS AND SOFTWARE TO RETRIEVE NH3 AND CO BASED ON THE OPTIMAL ESTIMATION APPROACH AND CONSTRAINTS THAT WE ADOPTED FOR TES NH3 AND MOPITT CO. THIS WILL ENABLE NASA TO CREATE CONSISTENT EXTENDED NH3 AND CO DATA RECORDS THAT WILL PROVIDE MODELERS WITH THE INFORMATION NEEDED FOR A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE PROCESSES IN WHICH EACH ARE INVOLVED. THIS IN TURN WILL INFORM THE POLICY DECISIONS THAT ULTIMATELY AFFECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE HEALTH OF OUR NATURAL ENVIRONMENT.

doc.ContractDescription: THE MAJORITY OF MATTER IN THE UNIVERSE IS DARK MATTER, MADE UP OF SOME PARTICLE BEYOND THOSE IN THE STANDARD MODEL OF PARTICLE PHYSICS. SO FAR WE HAVE VERY LITTLE INFORMATION ABOUT WHAT DARK MATTER IS AND HOW IT INTERACTS, EXCEPT THROUGH GRAVITY. CONSTRAINTS FROM HALO SHAPES AND THE BULLET CLUSTER GIVE UPPER BOUNDS ON THE SELF-INTERACTION STRENGTH OF DARK MATTER, BUT THESE BOUNDS ARE VERY WEAK: ROUGHLY THE SAME SIZE AS NUCLEAR PHYSICS CROSS SECTIONS, WHICH ARE VERY LARGE BY THE STANDARDS OF PARTICLE PHYSICS. GIVEN HOW LITTLE WE KNOW ABOUT DARK MATTER, IT IS IMPORTANT TO SEARCH FOR IT IN AS BROAD A CONTEXT AS POSSIBLE. EXISTING DIRECT AND INDIRECT DETECTION ANALYSES ARE TYPICALLY MOTIVATED BY SIMPLE PARTICLE PHYSICS MODELS LIKE WIMP DARK MATTER. THIS RESEARCH WILL AIM TO WIDEN THE SCOPE OF SEARCHES FOR DARK MATTER BY CONSIDERING A MORE COMPLETE RANGE OF PARTICLE PHYSICS MODELS, WORKING OUT THEIR IMPLICATIONS FOR ASTROPHYSICAL DATA, AND INTERPRETING EXISTING DATA IN TERMS OF THESE NEW MODELS. NEW MODELS OF DARK MATTER CAN AFFECT SEARCHES IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. SIGNALS MAY SHOW UP IN CONVENTIONAL INDIRECT DETECTION SEARCHES, E.G. IN GAMMA RAYS DETECTED BY FERMI- LAT OR IN ANTIPROTONS DETECTED BY AMS-02. THE NEW PARTICLE PHYSICS CONTENT OF THE MODELS COULD BE REFLECTED IN SURPRISING SPECTRAL SHAPES OR OTHER FEATURES OF SUCH SIGNALS, OR IN GAMMA RAYS WITH A DIFFERENT PROFILE ON THE SKY THAN EXPECTED IN TYPICAL MODELS. THE PI HAS WORKED, FOR EXAMPLE, ON A MODEL IN WHICH SIGNALS MAY ARISE FROM A DARK DISK, WHICH IS JUST ONE OF MANY POSSIBILITIES. SIGNALS OF NEW DARK MATTER MODELS MIGHT ALSO ARISE IN MORE SUBTLE WAYS. STRUCTURE IN THE DARK SECTOR COULD INFLUENCE THE DEVELOPMENT OF STRUCTURE IN THE VISIBLE SECTOR, INDIRECTLY. FOR INSTANCE, A DARK MATTER DISK OR OTHER DARK STRUCTURES COULD ALTER THE ORBITS OF STARS IN THE GALAXY AND MAY BE DETECTABLE THROUGH DETAILED STUDIES OF THE KINEMATICS OF STELLAR POPULATIONS. DARK ACCRETION DISKS COULD EXIST AROUND ASTROPHYSICAL OBJECTS. NONMINIMAL DARK MATTER MODELS ALSO OFTEN INVOLVE DARK RADIATION, WHICH AFFECTS THE COSMIC MICROWAVE BACKGROUND AND STRUCTURE FORMATION IN THE EARLY UNIVERSE, E.G. THROUGH THE DARK SECTOR ANALOGUE OF SILK DAMPING. THIS RESEARCH WOULD AIM TO EXPLORE SUCH IMPRINTS OF DARK MATTER INTERACTIONS ON COSMOLOGICAL OBSERVABLES. AS PART OF THIS RESEARCH WE WILL SURVEY NEW QUANTUM FIELD THEORY MODELS FOR DARK MATTER INTERACTIONS, WITH THE AIM OF EXPLORING OBSERVATIONAL CONSEQUENCES OF SUCH INTERACTIONS. FOR INSTANCE, SCENARIOS IN WHICH DARK MATTER IS A COMPOSITE PARTICLE OF A CONFINING GAUGE INTERACTION POTENTIALLY OFFER A WIDE RANGE OF SIGNATURES THAT HAVE NOT BEEN FULLY STUDIED. ANOTHER ASPECT OF THIS RESEARCH WILL BE TO ASSESS HOW STELLAR KINEMATICS DATA FROM SUCH SURVEYS AS RAVE, APOGEE, AND GAIA CAN CONSTRAIN THE DARK MATTER DISTRIBUTION IN THE GALAXY. THIS WILL BE USEFUL IF NEW DARK MATTER INTERACTIONS PREDICT UNUSUAL STRUCTURES (LIKE A DARK DISK), BUT ALSO TO OBTAIN MORE ROBUST CONSTRAINTS FROM TRADITIONAL INDIRECT DETECTION SEARCHES FOR DARK MATTER. ANOTHER ASPECT OF THIS RESEARCH WILL INVOLVE STUDIES OF POSSIBLE NONTHERMAL COSMOLOGICAL HISTORIES FOR INTERACTING DARK MATTER, WHICH MAY AFFECT THE OBSERVATIONAL PREDICTIONS. AS DATA FROM A VARIETY OF NASA MISSIONS ADDS TO OUR KNOWLEDGE OF ASTROPHYSICS, IT IS IMPORTANT TO KEEP IN MIND THAT WE DO NOT YET KNOW WHAT DARK MATTER IS AND WE HAVE ONLY BEGUN TO EXPLORE ALL OF THE WAYS THAT DARK MATTER COULD LEAVE SUBTLE SIGNALS IN DATA. THIS PROJECT, BY CONSIDERING MODELS IN WHICH DARK MATTER HAS UNCONVENTIONAL INTERACTIONS (EITHER WITH OTHER DARK MATTER PARTICLES OR WITH ORDINARY MATTER), WILL HELP TO MAKE THE FULLEST USE OF NASA DATA IN RESOLVING THE GREAT QUESTION OF THE NATURE OF THE HIDDEN MATTER IN OUR UNIVERSE.
doc.MajorAgency: ASTROPHYSICAL PROBES OF DARK MATTER INTERACTIONS
doc.MajorFundingAgency: ASTROPHYSICAL PROBES OF DARK MATTER INTERACTIONS

doc.ContractDescription: TASK ORDER TITLE: STRATEGIC MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS SUPPORT FOR ENERGY STAR PRODUCT PARTNERS THE PURPOSE OF THIS TASK ORDER IS PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES THROUGH COLLABORATION BETWEEN EPA, ITS PARTNERS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS TO FACILITATE COLLABORATION TO DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL AND INNOVATIVE MARKETING AND COMMUNICATIONS EFFORTS FOR ENERGY STAR CERTIFIED PRODUCTS AND PRACTICES THAT ENSURE THAT ENERGY STAR BRAND IS CENTRAL TO PARTNERS' EFFORTS TO PROMOTE ENERGY EFFICIENCY. THIS TASK ORDER WILL COVER SPECIFIC STRATEGIC MARKETING AND COMMUNICATION ACTIVITIES UNDERTAKEN BY EPA AND ITS CONTRACTORS TO PROMOTE ENERGY STAR LABELED PRODUCTS. SOME TASKS INCLUDED: ** MARKETING AND COMMUNICATION ACTIVITIES FOR THE ENERGY STAR RETAIL ACTION COUNCIL (RAC) AND THE ENERGY STAR RETAIL PRODUCTS PLATFORM (RPP); ** STRATEGIC MARKETING AND COMMUNICATION ACTIVITIES FOR ENERGY STAR LIGHTING AND APPLIANCES; ** STRATEGIC MARKETING AND COMMUNICATION ACTIVITIES FOR ENERGY STAR LIGHTING AND APPLIANCES; ** LOGISTICAL SUPPORT FOR THE 2015 ENERGY STAR PRODUCTS PARTNER MEETING; AND ** LOGISTICAL SUPPORT FOR 2016 ENERGY STAR PRODUCTS PARTNER MEETING THE PURPOSE OF MODIFICATION NO. 007 IS TO ADD INCREMENTAL FUNDING. doc.ContractDescription: 4535526457!PROVIDE ALL MATERIALS EQUIPMENT AND INC

THIS PROJECT WILL BE DEVOTED TO THE CONTINUING DEVELOPMENT OF THE MOLECULAR SPECTROSCOPIC LINE LISTS THAT WILL AID CURRENT AND FUTURE STUDIES OF PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES. SPECTROSCOPIC PARAMETERS FOR STUDIES OF THE TERRESTRIAL ATMOSPHERE HAVE BEEN COMPILED FOR MANY YEARS IN THE HITRAN DATABASE WHICH IS BEING MAINTAINED AND CONSTANTLY UPDATED AT THE HARVARD SMITHSONIAN CENTER FOR ASTROPHYSICS.THE HITRAN DATABASE IS CONSIDERED A US NATIONAL TREASURE AND IS ONE OF THE MOST CITED REFERENCES IN THE GEOSCIENCES. WHILE THIS DATABASE HAS BEEN SUCCESSFULLY USED BY DIFFERENT REMOTE-SENSING MISSIONS OF THE TERRESTRIAL ATMOSPHERE, THE EXTENT OF PARAMETERS CONTAINED IN HITRAN IS LACKING COMPLETION IN A MAJORITY OF CASES TO STUDY PLANETARY ATMOSPHERES. THE FUNDING FROM THE NASA AURA PROGRAM DOES NOT IMPLY SUPPORT OF ASTROPHYSICALLY IMPORTANT PARAMETERS, INCLUDING PARAMETERS FOR THE SPECIES THAT ARE NOT PRESENT IN THE EARTH ATMOSPHERE IN DETECTABLE AMOUNTS. NEVERTHELESS, HIGH RESOLUTION SPECTROSCOPIC PARAMETERS ARE EXTREMELY IMPORTANT WHEN INTERPRETING PLANETARY SPECTRA RECORDED WITH SPECTROMETERS LOCATED ON THE GROUND AND, MORE IMPORTANTLY, ON BOARD NUMEROUS CURRENT AND FUTURE SPACE MISSIONS INCLUDING SPITZER, HUBBLE, CASSINI, VENUS EXPRESS, JAMES WEBB SPACE TELESCOPE AND MANY OTHERS. CCURATE REFERENCE DATA ARE REQUIRED FOR DETERMINATION OF ATMOSPHERIC STRUCTURE AND COMPOSITION,INCLUDING THOSE OF EXTRASOLAR PLANETS, SEARCHES FOR TRACE CONSTITUENTS REPRESENTATIVE OF COMPLEX INTERACTIONS BETWEEN THE PLANETARY SURFACE AND THE ATMOSPHERE, THE INTERIOR OF THE DEEP AND UPPER ATMOSPHERE, AND SEASONAL ACTIVITY. AT THE PRESENT TIME, THE ASTROPHYSICS COMMUNITY HAS HAD TO RELY ON THE SCATTERED INFORMATION IN THE LITERATURE WHICH IS AVAILABLE IN A GREAT VARIETY OF UNITS, FORMALISMS AND FORMATS WHILE SOME COVER ONLY VERY LIMITED SPECTRAL RANGES. IN ADDITION, THESE DATA DO NOT HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF HAVING GONE THROUGH A VALIDATION AND FILTERING PROCESS SUCH AS EXISTS FOR HITRAN.
